definitions.definition: To move gently back and forth.
To cause to shake or sway violently.
To sway or tilt violently back and forth.
(of ore etc.) To be washed and panned in a cradle or in a rocker.
definitions.example: The ores had been rocked and laid out for inspection.

definitions.definition: To disturb the emotional equilibrium of; to distress; to greatly impact (most often positively).
definitions.example: Downing Street has been rocked by yet another sex scandal.

definitions.definition: To do well or to be operating at high efficiency.
To make love to or have sex with.
To play, perform, or enjoy rock music, especially with a lot of skill or energy.
To be very favourable or skilful; excel; be fantastic.
To thrill or excite, especially with rock music
To do something with excitement yet skillfully
definitions.example: I need to rock a piss.

definitions.definition: To wear (a piece of clothing, outfit etc.) successfully or with style; to carry off (a particular look, style).
The motion of something that rocks.
The abrading of a copper plate with a rocker, preparatory to mezzotinting.
The motion by which the design on a steel mill is transferred to a copper cylinder.
Shaking, swaying or moving back and forth.
